dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, hey B, you know, I was reading this Forbes article, and something Satya Nadella, the Microsoft CEO, said really caught my attention.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, hey B, you know, I was reading this Forbes article, and something Satya Nadella, the Microsoft C E O, said really caught my attention.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: He's basically calling for America to "reimagine capitalism." Like, a full-on referendum on it, especially given everything going on in 2020.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He's basically calling for America to reimagine capitalism. Like, a full-on referendum on it, especially given everything going on in twenty twenty.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Amid a global pandemic, months-long protests over racial inequality and a bitterly contested election, the CEO of the worlds second largest public company says now is the time for America to reimagine capitalism. Its fair, in today in 2020, in the midst of this pandemic, to essentially have a referendum on capitalism, Satya Nadella, Microsofts CEO, said Wednesday during the Forbes JUST 100 virtual summit.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow, [interrupts] that's pretty wild coming from the head of, uh, the world's second-largest public company, right? Especially with the pandemic and all the protests.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow, that's pretty wild coming from the head of, uh, the world's second-largest public company, right? Especially with the pandemic and all the protests.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Amid a global pandemic, months-long protests over racial inequality and a bitterly contested election, the CEO of the worlds second largest public company says now is the time for America to reimagine capitalism.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. He's saying companies need to redefine their "social core purpose." Not just about internal profits, but the jobs and revenue they create *outside* their walls.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. He's saying companies need to redefine their social core purpose. Not just about internal profits, but the jobs and revenue they create outside their walls.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We all have to recognize what is that social core purpose of a corporation. In short, Nadella said, companies like Microsoft should be measured by the number of jobs and revenue created outside of the company and the economic impact they have on the markets where they operate, as opposed to surpluses generated within a company.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, like, the broader economic impact on communities, not just their own bottom line. That sounds a lot like the "stakeholder capitalism" idea that's been gaining traction, doesn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, like, the broader economic impact on communities, not just their own bottom line. That sounds a lot like the stakeholder capitalism idea that's been gaining traction, doesn't it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Nadellas comments, which he says were inspired by a book published last year by Oxford management studies professor Colin Mayer, follow ongoing calls for business leaders to commit to steering their corporations toward so-called stakeholder capitalism.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It totally does. And it's not just him. The World Economic Forum at Davos made it their theme, and like, 200 CEOs, including Bezos, signed on to promote an economy that serves everyone.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It totally does. And it's not just him. The World Economic Forum at Davos made it their theme, and like, two hundred degrees c E O s, including Bezos, signed on to promote an economy that serves everyone.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Earlier this year, the World Economic Forum at Davos used the phrase as the theme for its annual event, a move that came after nearly 200 CEOs of large corporations including Amazon's Jeff Bezos and JPMorgan Chase's Jamie Dimon signed new guidelines by the Business Roundtable that specified the role of a corporation was to promote an economy that serves all Americans.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but, uh, I remember there was a report that kind of cast doubt on how committed some of those companies really are. [overlaps] I mean, easy to say, harder to do.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but, uh, I remember there was a report that kind of cast doubt on how committed some of those companies really are. I mean, easy to say, harder to do.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Though a recent report cast doubt on just how committed these companies are to stakeholder capitalism, Nadella pointed to Microsofts pledge to become carbon neutral by 2030, and highlighted a push by LinkedIn to address racial inequality as initiatives supported by shareholders.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: True, true. But Nadella pointed to Microsoft's own actions, like their pledge to be carbon neutral by 2030, and LinkedIn's efforts on racial inequality. Shareholders are actually supporting these.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: True, true. But Nadella pointed to Microsoft's own actions, like their pledge to be carbon neutral by twenty thirty, and LinkedIn's efforts on racial inequality. Shareholders are actually supporting these.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Though a recent report cast doubt on just how committed these companies are to stakeholder capitalism, Nadella pointed to Microsofts pledge to become carbon neutral by 2030, and highlighted a push by LinkedIn to address racial inequality as initiatives supported by shareholders.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Which is, I mean, pretty significant. And Microsoft has just exploded under his leadership, thanks to cloud services, which, like, boomed during the pandemic, so he's speaking from strength.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is, I mean, pretty significant. And Microsoft has just exploded under his leadership, thanks to cloud services, which, like, boomed during the pandemic, so he's speaking from strength.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Since Nadella took over as Microsoft CEO in 2013, the company has experienced explosive growth, in large part thanks to a booming cloud services business a sector that has only recorded surging demand during the pandemic as the global workforce was forced to work from home.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. But it wasn't just capitalism. He also touched on the upcoming federal election, saying Microsoft relies on a strong democracy and maintaining its institutions.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. But it wasn't just capitalism. He also touched on the upcoming federal election, saying Microsoft relies on a strong democracy and maintaining its institutions.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Beyond the pandemic and racial justice issues, Nadella also discussed the upcoming federal election, which has been overshadowed by President Donald Trumps assertions he may not accept its outcome. Nadella emphasized Microsofts reliance on a strong democracy and the need to maintain its institutions.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, that's another huge point. For a global tech giant, their standing really is tied to, uh, the vibrancy of American democracy, isn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, that's another huge point. For a global tech giant, their standing really is tied to, uh, the vibrancy of American democracy, isn't it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As an American company and tech company our standing in the world, and in the United States, comes because of the vibrancy of the American democracy, Nadella told Andrea Jung, the CEO of Grameen America, who hosted the talk.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, he basically said any business's standing, including theirs, depends on building on that strong institution of democracy, here and everywhere else.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, he basically said any business's standing, including theirs, depends on building on that strong institution of democracy, here and everywhere else.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: So therefore any standing of any business, including ours, depends on us building on that strong institution of democracy here and everywhere else.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, um, it's not just about profit for him, it's about purpose, impact, *and* the foundational systems that allow businesses to thrive. Pretty holistic view, honestly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, um, it's not just about profit for him, it's about purpose, impact, and the foundational systems that allow businesses to thrive. Pretty holistic view, honestly.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely. It's a pretty big statement to make, especially from someone in his position.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely. It's a pretty big statement to make, especially from someone in his position.
